preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: This is reference documentation for all user-configurable parameters in the DocBook XSL Slides stylesheets (for generating output from DocBook Slides documents).

This reference describes each of the parameters. These are the easily customizable parts of the stylesheet. If you want to specify an alternate value for one or more of these parameters, you can do so in a driver stylesheet.
For example, if you want to change the keyboard.nav parameter to 0, you might create a driver stylesheet like this:
Naturally, you have to change the href attribute on <xsl:import> to point to the stylesheet on your system.

preface.title: [none]
preface.para: There currently are no Slides parameters for FO output.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, JavaScript is added to the slides to enable keyboard navigation. Pressing 'n', space, or return moves forward; pressing 'p' moves backward.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Identifies the CSS stylesheet used by all the slides. This parameter can be set in the source document with the <?dbhtml?> pseudo-attribute css-stylesheet.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Identifies the default directory for the CSS stylesheet generated on all the slides. This parameter can be set in the source document with the <?dbhtml?> pseudo-attribute css-stylesheet-dir.
If non-empty, this value is prepended to each of the stylesheets.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Name of title foil HTML file

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Sets the filename used for the slides titlepage.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Sets the filename used for the table of contents page.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, a ToC will be placed on foilgroup pages (after any other content).

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the setting of the indent parameter on the HTML slides. For more information, see the discussion of the xsl:output element in the XSLT specification.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, JavaScript is added to the slides to make the bottom navigation appear at the bottom of each page. This option and multiframe are mutually exclusive.
If this parameter is zero, the bottom navigation simply appears below the content of each slide.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Show foil number on each foil?

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, on each slide there will be its number. Currently not supported in all output formats.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Output separator between navigation and body?

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, a separator (<HR>) is added between the navigation links and the content of each slide.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Height of ToC rows in dynamic ToCs

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This parameter specifies the height of each row in the table of contents. This is only applicable if a dynamic ToC is used. You may want to adjust this parameter for optimal appearance with the font and image sizes selected by your CSS stylesheet.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the background color used in the ToC frame.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the background color used in the body column of tabular slides.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the width of the ToC frame.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Enable hide/show button for ToC frame

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, JavaScript (and an additional icon, see hidetoc.image and showtoc.image) is added to each slide to allow the ToC panel to be toggled on each panel.

note.para: There is a bug in Mozilla 1.0 (at least as of CR3) that causes the browser to reload the titlepage when this feature is used.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, JavaScript is used to make the ToC panel dynamic. In a dynamic ToC, each section in the ToC can be expanded and collapsed by clicking on the appropriate image.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, JavaScript is used to keep the ToC and the current slide in sync. That is, each time the slide changes, the corresponding ToC entry will be underlined.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Logo to overlay on ToC frame

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If this URI is non-empty, JavaScript is used to overlay the specified image on the ToC frame.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Use multiple frames for slide bodies?

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: If non-zero, multiple frames are used for the body of each slide. This is one way of forcing the slide navigation elements to appear in constant locations. The other way is with overlays. The overlay and multiframe parameters are mutually exclusive.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Background color for top navigation frame

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the background color of the top navigation frame when multiframe is enabled.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Background color for bottom navigation frame

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the background color of the bottom navigation frame when multiframe is enabled.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the height of the navigation frames when multiframe is enabled.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Identifies the graphics directory for the navigation components generated on all the slides. This parameter can be set in the source document with the <?dbhtml?> pseudo-attribute graphics-dir.
If non-empty, this value is prepended to each of the graphic image paths.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the bullet image used for foils in the framed ToC.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the right-pointing navigation arrow.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the left-pointing navigation arrow.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the upward-pointing navigation arrow.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the home navigation icon.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the ToC navigation icon.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the inactive right-pointing navigation arrow.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the inactive left-pointing navigation arrow.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the inactive upward-pointing navigation arrow.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the inactive home navigation icon.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the inactive ToC navigation icon.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the plus image; the image used in a dynamic ToC to indicate that a section can be expanded.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the minus image; the image used in a dynamic ToC to indicate that a section can be collapsed.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the hide ToC image. This is used when the ToC hide/show parameter is enabled.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the show ToC image. This is used when the ToC hide/show parameter is enabled.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Identifies the JavaScript source directory for the slides. This parameter can be set in the source document with the <?dbhtml?> pseudo-attribute script-dir.
If non-empty, this value is prepended to each of the JavaScript files.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the UA JavaScript file. It's unlikely that you will ever need to change this parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the xbDOM JavaScript file. It's unlikely that you will ever need to change this parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the xbStyle JavaScript file. It's unlikely that you will ever need to change this parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the xbLibrary JavaScript file. It's unlikely that you will ever need to change this parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the xbCollapsibleLists JavaScript file. It's unlikely that you will ever need to change this parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the overlay JavaScript file. It's unlikely that you will ever need to change this parameter.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Specifies the filename of the slides JavaScript file. It's unlikely that you will ever need to change this parameter.
